reviews.text: I love this hotel. I have to travel frequently for work and have stayed in some dives for a stupid amount of money (the Best Western in Worthing springs to mind), but the Seagoe is a true gem. The welcome is warm, the rooms are huge and the food is just fantastic. Also you are not paying stupid corporate rates for the pleasure which is just brilliant. If they could just build a swimming pool then life would be perfect.
reviews.title: A haven in Portadown

reviews.text: Stayed here while on a business trip. I thought that the decor of the rooms realy needed updating, and anywhere which has blankets instead of duvets in this day & age gets a black mark in my book!
reviews.title: Could Do Better....

reviews.text: The water was only ever luke warm, and the wifi access does not extend to all rooms.
reviews.title: Superb
stunning and superb!!
reviews.text: On the plus side - the food and drink was reasonably priced and not too bad. You have to collect any newspapers which you order from reception rather than them being delivered to the room - a bit novel! I wouldn't mind so much if they had told me this before my last day there!!
I've been told that this is the best hotel in the area, which doesn't say too much for the others!
reviews.title: Very comfortable, affordable and quiet

reviews.text: This hotel almost seems out of place in Portadown. Its the type of place you would expect in a big city. Huge entrance, grand staircase, the BIGGEST room l have EVER seen in my life and a bathroom to match...!
reviews.title: A real gem....!

reviews.text: The place seemed almost empty most of the time. Very quiet and given its size, l would be surprised if it ever fills. However come meal time...the place comes to life..!! Cars & peopls come from all directions, which is understandable as the meals are excellent.
reviews.title: As good as it gets
Only if you really must........
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this place to everyone.
